website_summaries.verdict: A well-built, user friendly unit that will satisfy most kitchen and culinary demands.
pros: Switches easily between units of measure
Sleek, stylish look in a compact package
cons: Weighs in two-gram increments - accuracy can be an issue

customer_reviews.title: Worked great until it stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. Loved it. That only lasted two weeks. It broke after two weeks and is now useless. I left a negative review since there was no way to return it. Seller contacted me and asked me to remove review and he would refund me . He explained how he switched manufacturers because of continuing issues with the scales sold. He seemed genuine. I removed the review 9 days ago. I've seen no refund despite contacting him twice. So now he gets this review again. Not only is it a defective product, but it comes from a seller who doesn't hold up to his word.
customer_reviews.author: Lou Buono Jr

customer_reviews.title: It is super easy to use unlike some they tested which had ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it was the less expensive but still very highly rated pick from America's Test Kitchen online reviews (youtube). It is super easy to use unlike some they tested which had confusing menu buttons and too many features. It is very accurate scale, lightweight and easy to clean. The surface accommodates my largest mixing bowl. I like being able to leave the bowl on the scale and press "tare" between ingredients to keep adding while it's on the scale. Makes measuring so much easier. At the price listed, it's the best on the market.
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: Verified Consistant Results Using a Carbon Steel 100g OIML Class M1: 5 mg Calibration Weight
customer_reviews.text: I bought this scale a while back because I had a more expensive $45 glass scale from Target that seemed like it was not really consistent with weight results; to the point I purchased a Carbon Steel 100g OIML Class M1: 5 mg Calibration Weight. After testing my glass scale with the certified calibration weight, I quickly learned that the glass scale was definitely not consistent in providing weigh results. After receiving the Ozeri scale, I tested with my calibration weigh and the scale provided consistent results; $45 scale is out, and the $14 scale is in.
customer_reviews.author: TKTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Scale
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value, spot-on accurate (tested using 100gm calibration weight along with day-to-day items like 1/2 cup butter weighs exactly 4oz). We use this all the time in the kitchen. Measures very light things in the gram or oz. range, up to several pounds of potatoes. Every baker knows you should use a scale like this to measure. No-brainer to measure "1 cup" of flour (120g), no leveling, no sifting, just weigh out 120g/cup, and you get great results every time. How do you measure tablespoons of bulk farm fresh butter? Use this thing, 0.5oz./tablespoon. Tare works flawlessly. Grams or oz, your call A great all-around kitchen workhorse.
customer_reviews.author: Tim M

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this scale. Works great. I like that I can put a plate on it, zero it out and start measuring various foods so that I don't have to clean it over and over
customer_reviews.author: Amber Espinoza

customer_reviews.title: Junk!
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of junk! I bought this in April and it's already defunct. It started by registering wrong weights, so I put fresh batteries in, at which point it went completely dead. Tried another set of batteries to no avail. I don't recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: M. Munro

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste the money
customer_reviews.text: The instrument did not work from day one when I opened it. Read the instruction booklet and watched a U-Tube video on it. The display each time would put up letters and numbers that did nor correlate to any known unit of measurement. I was unable to get it to function at all. I returned to to Amazon for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen R. Herndon

customer_reviews.title: It does this almost all the time which sucks as the post office seems to be getting stricter ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't believe it's too% accurate. Most of the time when weighing things I intend to mail it fluctuates and can't seem to settle on an exact weight. Even if I increase the weight it still fluctuates back and forth between two slightly different numbers. It does this almost all the time which sucks as the post office seems to be getting stricter about weights and sometimes I find myself right on the edge between having to pony up an extra .21 cents. So it concerns me wondering how accurate it is.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny S

customer_reviews.title: turns on, but says everything weighs < 0.04oz
customer_reviews.text: I stupidly left this one in the box until the return period was over. When I did try it out, it didn't work. I took the thing apart to see if I could fix it, but the PCBs and connections looked good. The unit and on-off switches were swapped, which I found amusing (the switch PCBs were labeled). Perhaps something broke in the strain sensor, but that's covered in epoxy so I'd have no way to tell. I'm using a spring scale from Target now.
customer_reviews.author: Blub

customer_reviews.title: Loved this scale...WHILE IT WORKED
customer_reviews.text: I used this scale 3-4 times the first month I got it, and it worked GREAT. I loved it! It was everything I had hoped it would be. Yesterday, after having stored it a few months, I needed it again. However, it kept giving me an oVE2 error code every time I turned it on. I replaced the batteries...and still got the code. I looked up the code and found a website that instructs users how to take the scale apart and replace wires. I haven't done that...and probably won't. I seriously thought the scale would work longer than a month. Quite disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: J. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: It rounds up.
customer_reviews.text: I do not like the fact that it rounds up, say if something weighs 3.4 grams it will register 3 grams until you have 3.5. Then it rounds it up to 4. Not cool if you need precise weights.
customer_reviews.author: SapperSean

customer_reviews.title: The top looks like stainless but it's made out of plastic
customer_reviews.text: The top looks like stainless but it's made out of plastic. The bottom rubbers come off so easily after few times of use.
customer_reviews.author: Cho

customer_reviews.title: Dependable
customer_reviews.text: I've had this scale now for two years, and I'm bought another to just have for traveling. I use my scale daily because I have an OCD for measuring my food. I think I've changed the battery twice. And I haven't had any problems whatsever. I used to have the Ozeri touch kithen scale, and I had countless issues with that, where the weight would start decreasing after leaving it on there, and the battery itself required a 2032 which is pretty annoying. I think if anyone wants something cheap and dependable, this is the scale to go for. It has no frills but that's another reason why I think its built to last.
customer_reviews.author: Kang

customer_reviews.title: Failed in a week.
customer_reviews.text: It broke within the week (would no longer turn on) after only using it a few times. The build quality feels good, the numbers seemed accurate, but who gives a crap when it fails right away.
customer_reviews.author: Willy V

customer_reviews.title: Only worked a couple times
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this scale three months ago and have only used it a couple times. I used it today and the weight keeps flashing between two different weights and no matter where I move the product it can’t seem to make up its mind how much it weighs. I guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Good for items over 10 grams.  Not so great for anything less.
customer_reviews.text: Not as accurate as it should for small amounts. The test was measuring 5 gram increments. Using a nickel it would measure accurately every time since you are putting the weight down all at one time. I use the scale to measure baking ingredients, so I was measuring yeast. I could not consistently get a good measurement of 5 grams of yeast. Same with flour. This scale is great if you are measuring anything over 10 grams. Then the accuracy is better. Will give this one away and find another scale that will have better accuracy on the lighter side of things.
customer_reviews.author: P. Wong

customer_reviews.title: Light weight easy to use food scale
customer_reviews.text: Bought this food scale to do a keto diet, it is super easy to use. The difference of this one to others is that others are more expensive and have confusing menu buttons and too many features. As a chemist I know when a scale is accurate and I consider this one a very accurate one, lightweight and super easy to clean. In terms of size I think fits the best size to accommodate it in any corner of the kitchen. The surface permits to put almost any my mixing bowl. Love the option to press "tare" between ingredients to keep adding while it's on the scale. This makes taking measures easy. It's the best one on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Stgo

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate.
customer_reviews.text: I had noticed how such little food was weighing so much more than what I thought it should. Turns out after running tests, the scales are off and weighing things 33% heavier than they should be.
customer_reviews.author: L. Krecic

customer_reviews.title: I cannot recommend this scale. Waste of money and time.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. I keep it by itself on a shelf inside a cabinet. I have taken it out and used to make bread just 3 times. How did that little rubber foot/knob came off? No idea except for bad design and manufacturing. So what now? Too late to return and it just cannot do the job of weighting accurately all wobbly without one foot . I guess it will go in the trash. Wasted my money and my effort.
customer_reviews.author: MKS

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, Accurate, and Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: I really like this little scale. I checked it's accuracy against two other scales I own and it's dead accurate within 1/10th of a gram. I loved the price under $10 and the massive number of positive reviews. Another thing I like is that it's powered by 2 AAA batteries which were included. One of my other scales uses 2 CR2032's that don't last long. I like the ease of using common batteries that I always have on hand.
customer_reviews.author: GlennW

customer_reviews.title: Accurate, Cheap, Functional!
customer_reviews.text: What an amazing scale for the price you're paying! I own a couple of kitchen and food scales. One by Etekcity, one by Escali and now Ozeri. Ozeri functions just as well as my Escali scale which costed about 13 more dollars. It's super precise in terms of accuracy and super easy to use. My least favorite would probably be the Etekcity. Although their scale is great, it's way too sensitive. I definitely recommend the Ozeri if you're looking for a kitchen scale since it functions just as great as more expensive ones. Accuracy 5/5 ***** Ease of use 5/5 ***** My Recommendation 5/5 *****
customer_reviews.author: Vuong Ly

customer_reviews.title: Avoid it unless you want to keep changing batteries!
customer_reviews.text: The scale itself functions well like any other scale but it consumes so much battery on each use! No matter what brands of batteries or rechargeable ones, the scale will run out of power after each use. My time of usage is around 1-2 hours but it is not constantly on as the scale will turn off itself if it wasn't in use. This is super frustrating to change new batteries each time. You will end up paying so much on buying batteries. Avoid this product!
customer_reviews.author: C. CHOW

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for homemade sourdough
customer_reviews.text: I recently stepped up my homemade sourdough game and a baking scale was the next step. This scale feels well made and gives consistent readings. I have had over 2.5kg of flour/water on it and it was still reading. Inexpensive way to take your bread game to the next level.
customer_reviews.author: Paul G

customer_reviews.title: Bought wondering if I would even use it. Now I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: After binge-watching every season of the Great British Baking Show, I decided to spring for a kitchen scale not just for baking ingredients but for general cooking use as well. It's been even handier than I expected. This particular scale is light but tough, small but hardworking, easy to operate and to switch from imperial to metric measurements (when I'm using a British or Australian recipe), and to tare. It's saved me washing countless measuring cups because I tare a bowl or cup I'm using anyway, then measure the ingredient in it. I use it to control portion sizes as well. For such an inexpensive tool, it's really become indispensable in our kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Pookie

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use and clean. Only thing is that it’s completely plastic. The entire thing is made from cheap thin plastic and the measuring plate has a coating on it that chips off. I wouldn’t call it food friendly with paint chipping off. I accidentally ordered two somehow and when I wanted to return one, they wanted to charge me. It would’ve cost me more to return it than to keep it. So now I have two cheap pieces of plastic that are entirely impractical.
customer_reviews.author: N3lli3

customer_reviews.title: Better than Analog, but...
customer_reviews.text: Digital readouts help me to cook faster, but the auto turn-off feature will turn off WHILE you are weighing. So you have to have what ever you are weighing ready (i.e. don't shred your spinach into the bowl little by little). Also it likes to flicker crazily sometimes between numbers like it's having a seizure. Better than analog though and saves me time switching from gr to oz to ml, so I'll keep it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: SLM

customer_reviews.title: Owned for 2 years and a works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: I bought it in 2018 and it’s still going strong! This scale is accurate enough for me. I does *sometimes* bounce back and forth between grams if you’re between grams but it’s fine. I’ve dropped it in numerous occasions and the scale works perfectly. The battery life is amazing on this scale as I’ve only needed to change it once (just a few weeks ago). If you need a good scale for general food measurement, this is the scale for you.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly

customer_reviews.title: Helping me watch calories while on fat burn diet!
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be accurate. Not too expensive. Helping me watch my calorie intake -- that's how ALL diets really work. I have lost 14 pounds of fat in 28 days due to help from this food scale's measurements of weights of various things that I ingest regularly. I found the calories per gram, Tbsp, Tsp, other measure online easily for everything I ingest. Just another 19 pounds to go, now, to achieve my bodily weight goal. I will reach that goal in about 6 more weeks. Thank you, people of Ozeri!
customer_reviews.author: Serobi56

customer_reviews.title: Not spill friendly
customer_reviews.text: This is a kitchen scale. It's made for measuring liquids and solids. If you use it in the kitchen, it's eventually going to get wet (spills, splashes, what have you). My experience is that if this gets wet at all (anything more than, as the manual stipulates, a 'damp' cloth) it will simply stop working entirely. Bottom line, this scale will not last in the environment for which it was built. It's only a matter of time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Food Scale for your Home
customer_reviews.text: After bariatric surgery, I started a new life of weighing all of my food to maintain the guidelines from my surgeon and nutritionist. This scale is a key part of my success when at home. It's a great product as a good price - easy to use and looks good. I've had it for almost a year now and I'm still as happy with it as the day I bought it. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Brian B

customer_reviews.title: Accurate scale!
customer_reviews.text: This scale has served all sorts of purposes for us, and I love all of the different unit options. The only feature I would change is that you cannot use it for more than about 20 or 30 seconds -- it automatically shuts itself off. So for instance, if you are trying to prepare something that takes some time and add it bit by bit to a container on the scale to get it to exactly the right weight, the scale is going to turn itself off and tare to zero if you don't take the container off of it first. A little bit of a nuisance that could be avoided without such a quick auto shut off feature.
customer_reviews.author: Sophie Erstad

customer_reviews.title: I did not purchase this for food but...
customer_reviews.text: I used this product to weigh hair color... It works well and happy with this affordable price!!
customer_reviews.author: LaineTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Cheap junk but works good enough.
customer_reviews.text: It's good enough to start candle making. But the 100ths position jumps in 3-5 increments. I remove wax chips when the meter jumps up, then put back an appropriate amount back and know it's about at the number it should be. I wouldn't buy it again. Because the weigh plate is plastic and a not a good scale for candle making. I will get a a much larger scale, metal construction, and higher resolution measurements.
customer_reviews.author: Kintama

customer_reviews.title: My wife LOVES this little scale for the kitchen, and I too think it's pretty good
customer_reviews.text: My wife wanted a scale for KETO and other kitchen duties. (she chose the green one) Perfect size, the right weight capacity for our needs. I actually use it to roll our own KEURIG baskets and measure out the right weight of fresh ground coffee we choose on a given day. No complaints at all here. This is a GREAT item for the kitchen. Just be reasonable with what you expect out of it as per its designed capacity. We also like that this takes a conventional battery, not a watch battery like many of these types of scales so.And simple to clean the scale. The beauty of simplicity.
customer_reviews.author: FoghornLeghorn

customer_reviews.title: Easy, accurate: portion control helper for weight loss
customer_reviews.text: Small, accurate with several measuring modes. I love weighing a bowl before resetting to zero, then adding food or ingredients. No more guessing at portion size, which I had been struggling with. Weighing food has helped me lose an average of two pounds per week for six weeks! Four stars because it can get a bit messy and takes a bit of cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: DotIowa

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: The Tare is always fluctuating and never accurate. Only used a few times and now I have to Shell out more money for a new one 😒
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Best digital scale!
customer_reviews.text: Lovely kitchen scale! I've been baking for a while but always used to make do with measuring equipments, doing very complicated calculations. I decided I needed a kitchen scale when I started seeing recipes which required me to add 3/8th of an egg or whatever. Decided to get this one based on reviews, and it's perfect. Tares down to zero, gives the weight in different units, auto-powers off quickly, very accurate, and easy to clean up. It's made my life so much easier and my baking better! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: tiya

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and Accurate but Small! Love it!
customer_reviews.text: We got this for when we buy meat in bulk and vacuum seal it for the freezer. However, since we got it, we have used it for many other things as well! It came in handy when I had a package to ship and I needed the weight to calculate shipping costs. It also came in handy for weighing items for Christmas baking. I placed a small bowl on it, zeroed out the weight of the bowl, then filled the bowl to get the exact amount of the ingredient by weight! This scale is so small I just slide it in a drawer when not in use which clears up more of my counter space. I just love it!
customer_reviews.author: Cstritt

customer_reviews.title: Lasted five years! Buying a new one
customer_reviews.text: I use my kitchen scale several times a week, and keep it in the top drawer. It gets banged around a lot, and recently the tare button has worked intermittently. After reading several reviews of various kitchen scales, I decided to replace same with same. There are several that are very slightly higher rated, but they cost four or five times more, and would take up much more room in my drawer. The flat design, accuracy, ease of use, storage, and very reasonable cost of this scale made me purchase a replacement and write this review. I highly recommend the Ozeri for home cooks and bakers.
customer_reviews.author: Abby Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: The scale stopped providing accurate readings. I would weigh something, remove it, and weigh it again and receive a different number. After troubleshooting with the manufacturer I received a replacement, but after 4 months the same thing happened. I am now in search of a scale from a different company. I bake 3-4 times a week and all of the recipes I created are metric so I rely heavily on accuracy for consistent results, which this does not provide.
customer_reviews.author: Francisca A.

customer_reviews.title: Sucks. Really sucks.
customer_reviews.text: The scale work for a little while when I first started using it. I put in brand new batteries in the whole nine yards and now a month or two later it's not working anymore. I'm trying to weigh my flour for my bread and it's totally underweighing it. I put my container on it then I turn it on then I start putting my stuff in it and it's giving me completely wrong readings. I'm really unhappy and I wish I could get my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Butterballer

customer_reviews.title: Weight isn’t accurate, things weigh different each time
customer_reviews.text: The scale simply doesn’t work, weight is inaccurate! Bought it for hair dying noticed it wasn’t adding things correctly. Sure enough, silly me I never tested it out on a simple basic product first! I weighed my phone, not moving anything but phone on and off placing it on the same spot on scale... it weighed different each time. Not happy do not buy if you want accurate weight to the oz
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great so far for coffee
customer_reviews.text: I've been using it to measure out both coffee grounds and water for an Aeropress coffee maker. I love how it's possible to switch between the units of measure, since coffee is usually measured in grams and the water is measured in ounces. I place the Aeropress on the scale, tare the scale, add the coffee grounds to the correct grams, switch to ounces, tare again, then add the hot water to the correct amount. Works great! Instructions are well-written, indicating this is not a cheap Chinese import. The company seems legit.
customer_reviews.author: K. Brisbin

customer_reviews.title: Platform fell off after 4 months of light use
customer_reviews.text: It works, it weighs things. But it’s extremely flimsy - after several months of light use, the top platform (the flat bit where you put whatever you want to weigh) has come off, and while it seems to snap back on, it’s much less secure and more wobbly than before. I didn’t spend much on it, but still...not really thrilled with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: l3bowsk1

customer_reviews.title: just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: This scale is a great value, I've used it a ton for baking. A lot of recipes only put ingredient measurements in weight, which is a better way to measure anyway. I do wish it showed more precise increments (for example I've made recipes that call for 3.5g yeast but the scale only shows whole grams), but overall it does everything I need. You can tare it to measure right into mixing bowls, and easily switch between different units. Highly recommended for anyone who likes to bake.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: My little work horse
customer_reviews.text: I use this little guy a lot. Probably on the order of 7 - 8 times a day. I've been impressed with it's accuracy with measurements for even tiny amounts, like under 10 grams. It's a snap to tare a container. I sometimes have to push a dinner plate off center on it so that I can see the weight display as I measure out portions, but having the weight off center doesn't affect the scale's ability to measure accurately. It's easy to keep clean. The only thing I wish it had was a loop so that I could hang it over the counter for easy access.
customer_reviews.author: CurlyGrl

customer_reviews.title: GREAT UNOBTRUSIVE SCALE
customer_reviews.text: So glad I purchased this! I put it off as I had a perfectly usable old plastic scale tucked away that I could pull out when I wanted it. But, THIS IS SO MUCH EASIER! It quietly sits on my counter, is easy to turn on. It doesn't gobble batteries and you can set up Tare, so you only get the weight of the food, not the weight of the food and container. It's really helpful and has become indispensable. Great Purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Talbot

customer_reviews.title: Hopefully a long-lasting, accurate food scale
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this scale 3 days so can't yet comment on durability and long-term accuracy. It arrived in its box in an envelope lined with bubble wrap. The box had been crushed on the side, so it had taken a beating during shipping. The reading was initially off when I installed the batteries, but after turning the scale off and then on again it zeroed out. It appears to be accurate now. I hope it wasn't damaged during shipping to the point it won't last or maintain accuracy. Time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: D. Parkinson

customer_reviews.title: I’ve had this for 5 years! It’s lasted 5 years!!
customer_reviews.text: So I looked this up because my mom asked where I got it. Turns out I’ve had it for 5 years! 5 years and it’s still going strong! I looked up previous scales and owned each one for less than a year. So imagine my surprise when I realized how long this one had lasted. So all those 5 star reviews are accurate, in my opinion. My favorite thing about this scale is that I can use it for baking. It’s sturdy enough to put my mixing bowl on and measure out my ingredients (I only like to use weight when baking).
customer_reviews.author: Amanda J. Cowan

customer_reviews.title: Great For Baking Accuracy!
customer_reviews.text: One of my favorite hobbies is baking! I've always used dry cup measures but been curious about baking with weight measures instead. This scale helped me do that. I'm a big fan of the Great British Bake Off so I decided to experiment with a British classic-- a basic Victoria Sponge. I found a recipe that had both cup measures and weight measures in grams and tried it both ways. The weight measure one definitely came out better in terms of texture! Scale is really easy to use even if you don't read the included instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: I've had this for more than 6 years and still use it all the time!
customer_reviews.text: I would absolutely buy this again! I don't just use it for portion size though, I often use it for cooking/baking. If you've ever watched The Great British Baking Show, you can get all of the recipes online, but they're in weigh measurements. The Brits don't use cups and teaspoons etc. It's either grams, or ounces. This little darling will do both/either. Super easy to use, easy to wipe down, and long lasting at a great price. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amy M Ralph

customer_reviews.title: 5 years later still love it!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect little scale for measuring food amounts! I originally bought it for portion control purposes, but have also switched to measuring my baking ingredients by weight because it's much more accurate. I like that the scale itself is also light weight, so I take it with me when I go somewhere and might need it for my diet. 5 years later, the plastic over the power button has become a little bubbled, but I don't mind and still use it every day!
customer_reviews.author: Anonima

customer_reviews.title: Best food scale!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried various food scales, and this is my favorite. The buttons are easy to use, very responsive, and clearly labeled. This scale gives you all the options of grams, oz, lbs, and ml. Scale also "zeros" and "clears" flawlessly. My only complaint is that it is kind of hard to turn off the scale (I just leave it alone and it turns off in about a minute). I've used this scale to track macros and even to bake delicate desserts such as French macarons, and it has never lead me astray. I own two of these scales because I love them so much! Cute colors also help!
customer_reviews.author: Fun, thrifty, and thriving

customer_reviews.title: Easy & accurate
customer_reviews.text: Used this 2-3 times now, and it works great. Definitely makes keto & gluten-free baking more accurate. **All the other reviews saying it's inaccurate and showing pictures with the weight stated on the food item, and the scale showing it's off are pretty hilarious. Those folks are clearly not taking into account the weight of the packaging, as the net weight on food items is only the weight of the food, not including whatever container it's in.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Really Wanted this but it Did Not Work from the Get-Go!
customer_reviews.text: Asked for a refund because the scale only showed the worst error code according to the manual from the moment I turned it on. The manual stated to do a hard reset by taking batteries out (which are provided) and waiting a few seconds and replacing. Nothing changed on the scale screen each time I did this- and I did this 4x. So frustrating. I purchased this scale because I liked the price and I wanted to use it for baking- but I guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm so disappointed, I had high hopes after researching the product
customer_reviews.text: I bought the scale last year I used it three times and now it no longer works, I have no idea why it just stopped working, I'm so disappointed, I had high hopes after researching the product. I can not do my hydroponics now and I just got the Masterblend, what a bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer CT

customer_reviews.title: nearly four years, going strong
customer_reviews.text: I bought this about four years ago and it still works great! I use it all the time, and not just for food. For example, I use it to weigh small packages so I can print postage only and avoid the Post Office. I can't speak to it's accuracy scientifically but anecdotally I think it's pretty spot on. I've dropped it a few times and it still works. It's also pretty easy to clean and doesn't show a lot of wear after all this time. I recommend this scale!
customer_reviews.author: Mme Dupont

customer_reviews.title: Good scale with minor complaints
customer_reviews.text: I use this daily, as I used to be fat and want to stay not fat. Scale seems to be accurate. Minor complaints : When you put a plate on it, hard to see the numbers. You have to balance it to the back, somewhat. The plastic over the buttons is beginning to bubble. It still works, so it's just cosmetic. The buttons are very particular. If you don't push them perfectly, the options don't change. Again, minor complaints. It does what it's supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: splorp!

customer_reviews.title: Completely Defective upon Arrival
customer_reviews.text: Right after opening the package and inserting the provided batteries for the first time, the scale was already broken. Randomly numbers would flash on the display, and placing an object on the scale would not show the weight. The tare button didn't work and would not tare or power off the scale. The changing units button was the only thing that worked, but the display was still completely messed up with zero ability to be used. Definitely returning this product and buying a better alternative. Even if it worked, the product feels very cheap in your hands. Never buying from this manufacturer again.
customer_reviews.author: William Gao

customer_reviews.title: Very Inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: I was measuring out various veggies separately for a salad, Each time I wiped out the bowl & placed it back on the scale it was a different weight. It would go up then down. Fluctuated from 6.89-7.34???? So went out and bought a different one.
customer_reviews.author: Teri Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Love this scale. Priceless
customer_reviews.text: I’m amazed at how much more I was actually eating than I thought I was before I got this scale. I am shocked at how light veggies are in comparison to proteins and fats. I’ve shifted the portion sizes for a healthier more balanced diet. Every house should have a scale And use it to measure their serving sizes religiously. I’ve lost 8lbs in a month just by weighing my food and measuring out recommended portion sizes.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Food Prep and Portions are the Key
customer_reviews.text: Another very important tool I purchased from Amazon for my weigh loss journey. This helps me to track with accuracy the portions of the foods I am preparing and eating. Easy to use... lightweight...takes up little space on the counter and stores easily in my plate cabinet if I desire. Food preparation is the key to success in a weight loss journey and this helps keep me on track along with the tracking scale I also purchased.
customer_reviews.author: ClassicElements

customer_reviews.title: This is a Great Buy!!
customer_reviews.text: So light, inexpensive, and easy to use and accurate! I use it for practically everything. I am SO GLAD that I found this item. Doesn't take much space at all, and it sits on my island for convenient use. You can easily switch units of measure with the press of a button. You can easily deduct the weight of a container as it sits on the scale (to equal zero) so that what goes into it is accurately weighed. Extremely light-weight (you'd think it was junk), but it works very well!! What a terrific buy! Much recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Fire Horse

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, converts between five units
customer_reviews.text: This scale is a great quality for the price. The weighing portion (top) of the scale is made of a shiny lightweight plastic, while the bottom portion is made of heavier matte plastic. This scale runs on 2 AAA batteries, which are included. I haven't tested this, but it says it weighs up to 11.24lbs. I primarily use this for baking and cooking. It has all the functions of a basic scale (on/off, weight with decimals, tare function). Something I didn't expect was that it can display five different units (grams, milliliters, pounds, pounds + ounces, and ounces) and convert between them. It's really convenient for when you're following recipes and don't want to convert things on your own.
customer_reviews.author: cstar

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: Though I haven't used it more than a couple of times, I can say there is much to like about this device: Generous platform to hold dish; easily readable weight; adequate capacity (up to several pounds). I've been storing it in the manufacturer's box because it's flat and easier to find a place in my cabinet -- and storing it in it's packaging puts no pressure on the scale. Also because the packaging makes it easy to remove and store the batteries outside the device -- thus -- I trust -- prolonging the life of the two double AA batteries that came with it. Had I been using it more, I'd likely have given it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: serious java

customer_reviews.title: Great scale
customer_reviews.text: It worked very well for me. I used it to weigh the ingredients for CP soap making and having the 0.01 results is great. The only thing I don't like is that I can't manually calibrate it. So I used my F1 class calibration weights to test the accuracy and it was right on the money. For the money you can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Zig Top Contributor: Gardening

customer_reviews.title: I'm pleased.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this scale needing to weigh food and an occasional letter. It is extremely easy to use. I said that it is accurate, but I'm not sure how I would know about that unless I had something to compare it to, which I don't. I keep it in a drawer. It doesn't take up any room because it is small. But if I needed to leave it out on the counter in the kitchen, it would be fine. It looks nice!
customer_reviews.author: Fhaley

customer_reviews.title: Delighted with this kitchen scale!
customer_reviews.text: Compact for easy storage but big enough for practical use. Nice design with large display and 2 buttons. No learning curve required or reading instructions required. Used it to weigh different flours making bread today. Took about 30 seconds to add the bread flour, tare it, add the whole wheat flour. No more sifting, measuring cups and getting flour everywhere. Not planning on using it for really simple things easily measure like salt, yeast, etc. This one is a deal at $10. I'll revise my review down the road if necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Baking with a scale is a must and this one is the right one!
customer_reviews.text: This is a GREAT scale at a GREAT price. I will never bake without a scale ever again. I've been converted. It's amazing how much variation there is when an order calls for one cup of flour. That can vary by almost 100gms. Using a scale when baking is a MUST and this one works great. It's accurate, very light weight and easy to clean. I highly recommend buying this scale. I also love that it comes in so many different colors. I played it safe and purchased white but I might buy another one and be a little adventurous. Worth the money!!
customer_reviews.author: TawO

customer_reviews.title: Noom game changer!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been on Noom for seven weeks. I like it, but weight loss has been slow, despite doing everything right. Someone suggested I get a food scale to more accurately measure portions. Dang! Wish I’d known from the beginning! It makes more sense to measure things in grams instead of general/vague terms like “1 slice of watermelon.” I was way underestimating calories. This little scale is awesome! Easy to use and seems very accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Martha Cole

customer_reviews.text: I reallllllyy wanted to love this.. but every time I try to tar something out it’ll bounce from the actual tar weight to .5 under it... at first I thought it was just the batteries so I put new ones in..nope.. it’s on a flat service so I donno.. maybe mines defective 😭 Other than that major annoyance it’s very easy to use and really it’s pretty nice..
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Great scales at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: I got this to measure my portions so I could track my food intake on the CarbManager app. This is actually my second set of kitchen scales so I could keep one at the office. Seems to work great. I haven't seen anything that would cause me to doubt is accuracy, but I haven't used it next to my other scales or measure a known weight. The ability to tare the weight of a container and measure in early ounces or grams were a must and it does all that perfectly. I would totally recommend these scales.
customer_reviews.author: tRaV

customer_reviews.title: Every kitchen needs one!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first ever food scale and I LOVE it! After meal prepping for the week I realized that I was seriously under eating in terms of how much meat I thought made up 4 ounces. I still can’t finish 4 ounces of meat but it’s fantastic to know that I’ve prepped the exact amount of a serving size! I used it to weigh pasta too (again, something I was seriously underestimating the weight of). I feel like this little gagdet will help me stay on track with my diet because I’m actually eating the correct servings sizes!
customer_reviews.author: Jillian

customer_reviews.title: impressive- very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I just started baking during the stay at home order. I did not know how weighing the ingredients is so important in baking so I started to look around for a scale. I love how it is priced so well which was my first consideration as I do not even know the famous brands for baking. I also went with reviews and found that this scale really works well. I love the tare function. It is also small and can be stored easily.
customer_reviews.author: Lon

customer_reviews.title: Go metric for baking!
customer_reviews.text: A food scale is a necessity not just for dieters, but also for bakers who believe in exact measurements! Small differences in ingredient amounts can take a recipe from delicious success to miserable failure, so I use recipes with metric measurements exclusively now. This scale, while inexpensive, does everything it needs to do—and accurately. The tare function allows me to measure a series of different ingredients into the same mixing bowl, less mess!
customer_reviews.author: LegoGirl

customer_reviews.title: This item was delivered in time for me to begin my holiday baking, which was important to me.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the ease of use. I buy powdered sugar in bulk because I make "Martha Washington Balls" for Christmas and need to get a head start. I tried it out soon after I received it. I measured 2 lbs. of confectionary sugar out in a 1-gallon plastic zip-lock bag. It measured two lbs. perfectly. It will be handy for lots of other food measurements during the holiday season. It's a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Great compact scale!
customer_reviews.text: This is our second purchase of this model. Works great, easy to store, and I love the four measurement options: oz, grams, lbs, lbs & oz. First one lasted almost exactly one year with a lot of use. I think the only reason it failed is because the batteries leaked. I learned that it was best to store it on its side since certain family members kept stacking on top of it -- never stack stuff on your scales.
customer_reviews.author: D and A's Mom

customer_reviews.title: i’m in love
customer_reviews.text: Dude. This scale is a game changer. I recently got really into making bread and like if you’ve ever made bread you know that you absolutely have to measure by weight or you’ll end up with something that’s just... wrong. It showed up right on time too! I ordered this alongside a textbook to soften the blow. Spend a bit of money on something I want to feel better about spending a bit of money on something I don’t want. Plus it matches my kitchenaid!! So if you have a blue kitchenaid buy the blue colored scale, it’ll match and be so cute!
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Nice functional small scale
customer_reviews.text: I like that it has measurements in both oz and gram. There is a "tare" button that lets you reset the scale to 0 after you place a bowl on top of the scale and you can fill that bowl with your sugar, flour, etc. I use it a lot and have not come across any problem with it. Use it gently and turn off at the end of your session. Also it doesn't eat up a lot of battery use, it has been a year and I haven't had to change the batteries
customer_reviews.author: Green Moss

customer_reviews.title: It could be better
customer_reviews.text: It's good, but the shutdown time is too short. Maybe only a minute and a half, maybe less. Consistent measures weights for me using the gram scale. I don't use the other scales. It measures "ml"--no it doesn't, because this item measures weight, not volume, unless it's water you're measuring. Anything else (honey, oil) with a different density won't register the proper volume. The weighing platform is a bit small and close to the measurement window, so anything bigger than a dessert plate will block your view. Still working, so 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey WXXX

customer_reviews.title: I full reccomend.
customer_reviews.text: I've gone through a couple of these over the years.. They last about 1-2 years in my experience, where the other reccomended, etekcity or something like that, broke as soon as a bit too much water went on top of it. No good. Anyways, buying my third one right now. I use these suckers 10x a day measuring liquids, cereal,meat, etc etc. The only downfall I find is that it doesn't measure initial 1 - 2g of something like powders. Meaning that If I put 1g of a powder on the scale, it won't register until maybe 3 or 4g. then every gram continually adds up/ measures. If you're looking for very small measuements, buy a weed scale ;)
customer_reviews.author: Joey Kostyal

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Scale
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to measure sugar for my jam recipes (as sugar no longer comes in 5# bags. I have now started baking breads and this scale is just awesome (most of my recipes are in British units). If you want an inexpensive but accurate kitchen scale - this one fills that bill.
customer_reviews.author: P. Wiman

customer_reviews.title: Just what kitchen needed!
customer_reviews.text: I have only put the batteries that come with it and to make sure that it works and it did. It's very lightweight but I'm sure it will get the job done. It has different modes that you can set for pounds, ounces, milliliters etc and will subtract the weight of the dish the product is in before weighing your recipe. Looks like it will last a while. I have no problems recommending it at this time.
customer_reviews.author: A. S.

customer_reviews.title: Nice kitchen scale
customer_reviews.text: Trying to get healthy in quarantine and this scale has made it much easier. Accurate and easy to use. Love the tare function to zero out scale as I add ingredients. Also the negative balance as I remove is surprisingly useful. Overall quality is good. Just wish the weighing table was stainless. Seems like a cheap coated plastic but hopefully it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: JML

customer_reviews.title: very nice
customer_reviews.text: I'm using it to measure bass and guitar strings before I ship them to be recycled (there's a weight minimum to make it worth their time). Love the tare feature. The scale is reliable, consistent, and sturdy, with a good display that's easy to read. Just make sure the circular plate is really what you're after--for me it's fine, but if you were trying to line up lots of little bars of something (like scientific weights) that all have 90 degree corners, you might look into getting a scale with square corners.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Bad packaging, Okay product
customer_reviews.text: I follow the carnivore diet and I use this to measure my portions of meat to keep them at around a pound per meal. Many uses. I do wish the Amazon packaging was better, since it came with only it's base packaging that has only a film of plastic over the scale. It was clear that pressure had been applied through the plastic onto the scale in shipping or storage. This lowered my confidence that the scale was undamaged. I have tested it with predetermined weights and it seems sound in my case, but that's just luck as far as I'm concerned.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Dempsey

customer_reviews.title: A life saver! Use it almost everyday!
customer_reviews.text: When I got this little scale, my wife was kind of angry. It's small, looks fragile and we never though we needed one until we tried it. Now cooking is stress free thanks to this tiny little scale. We measure anything and everything we cook. Helps to follow recipes properly. I have also used it to make salads and to measure food portions. I was following KETO diet recipes and this helped a lot. Lost about 15lb (feels so good!) and had to stop the diet due to this pandemic situation. However, we still use this scale for all other recipes! Little life savior!
customer_reviews.author: Md Sufian

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, stupendous scale
customer_reviews.text: If you want to cook from European cookbooks, then its imperative to have a scale like this. I lived in Germany more than 20 years ago and back then the price for a similar scale was $70+, so I was shocked by the price- happily surprised. After buying it, I made marzipan Christmas stollen, cinnamon stars, and German lebkuchen - they were a huge hit at Christmas. I'm not a good baker, but these flew off the plate and people were begging for more. I can't wait to make more from my European cookbooks. Best part, it's tiny. It fits well into my drawer.
customer_reviews.author: DC Erin

customer_reviews.title: Great price and excellent quality!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a diet that we couldn't stick to. But, I now use it for keeping my Pugs food portions strictly controlled. The Tare Weight feature lets me subtract the weight of their bowls, which makes the process very accurate. You can decide which measurement system you wish to use, with one touch, grams, ounces, etc. It takes up very little counter space and is attractive in external design.
customer_reviews.author: Leefers1

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and to read!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Digital read out panel is easy to read even if I have a dinner size plate on it. Many units of weights available to use, metric as well as US measures. Has a timer to turn itself off when it has set idle for a few minutes to save battery power. My baking has taken a whole new turn. I can use the metric measures for European recipes with the hassle of doing the conversions myself.Easy to understand instructions!! Well packaged, delivery was fast. Battery is included. Very happy with this purchase and this seller. If your looking for a kitchen scale this fills the bill very well. Highly recommend this scale. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Moonminx

customer_reviews.title: My Wife is Happy with knowing what 4 ounces looks like!
customer_reviews.text: On time and arrived in good condition. So simple, even with Tare weight so you can place a bowl, first then add your food item and bingo, fast and accurate. Nice large numbers, auto shut off in 2 mins. Would highly recommend to friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S.

customer_reviews.title: Great, inexpensive little scale
customer_reviews.text: I use this primarily to make sure I don't overfeed my small dogs that eat raw venison. The scale is quite accurate and easy to use. It is really light weight. I noted others that complained about the weight sometime twitching between two weights - for example 3.46 and 3.52. I've noticed that as well, but it always happens when I drop a very small amount on the scale. I gently press down on the pressure plate and release and the weight usually settles one way or the other.
customer_reviews.author: cairn terrier lover

customer_reviews.title: No frills get the job done scale.
customer_reviews.text: With what I paid for this I knew there wasn't anything special about it. Nor did I expect or want anything special. It's a scale meant for weight food. It does what I need it to without ever disappointing me. I've had it for a few months and it's preformed flawless for someone that uses it at least 3 times a week for about 30 mins each use. I use this specifically for meal prep. So if you want something special keep looking. If you want something that does it's specific job at a low price then hit purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Rico and Family

customer_reviews.title: Just bought it, but so far I'm really pleased
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to weight out green coffee beans prior to roasting them. The density and size of coffee beans can vary quite a bit, and i was getting frustrated with my small mechanical kitchen scale because it often didn't have the capacity to weight out 8oz lots. This digital scale allows me to tare out any container I wish, making it very convenient. It worked well out of the box and the weights were accurate compared to my other scale. Now to see how long the scale continues working, hopefully for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: pc6

customer_reviews.title: Great food scale. recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Great food scale, I would recommend. Good accuracy, easy to use, has a few different units which is convenient. Good battery life. Have been using it for three months now, no problems.
customer_reviews.author: A.Jiang

customer_reviews.title: Skeptical at first
customer_reviews.text: When I first received this, I was taken aback by how light weight it is. Our current kitchen scale is smaller than this but has a glass top, so I was used to a bit more heft. That said, I needed a scale that would read in small increments, which this seems to do. I also purchased a 100g calibration test weight, and both my old scale and this new scale weighed it perfectly. I haven't really put it through its paces yet but my initial inspection and testing are positive.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Gallion

customer_reviews.title: Save Money by purchasing from Amazon Warehouse
customer_reviews.text: Product came on time before Christmas Day. The box was slightly injured but that was disclosed when I ordered it from Amazon. Package was not damaged to the point that I couldn’t gift the scale to someone. If I can save a buck or two , I will sacrifice looks as long as the item works. I am happy with the purchase and will order items from Amazon Warehouse again. Save your money and buy re-packaged vs New , you get same quality.
customer_reviews.author: TechGirl99

customer_reviews.title: Love my new scale!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help me in measuring my food to aid in weight loss. It works beautifully and is easy to use. It doesn't take much space either. The price made me hesitate because it was so inexpensive but it doesn't look cheap and performs very well.
customer_reviews.author: Dixiegirl

customer_reviews.title: I am a believer
customer_reviews.text: I baked a few loves of bread and did not have the consistency I desired. Saw a Youtube video where a gentlemen explained that the flour and water needed to be weighed in baking. I googled baking scales and this unit was really top of the line for simplicity and accuracy. So I gave it a shot and ordered this scale. Remarkable, unit. light as well as easy to use. The price was very reasonable as well. I never bake bread now without weighing the flour and water and have had excellent baking results.
customer_reviews.author: Apple Convert

customer_reviews.title: Great scale
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd Ozeri scale I’ve bought. I hope the quality did not decrease. I got one 5 years ago and still works great, only replaced the batteries once. I got this one for my office. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: pargat singh

product_meta.title: Ozeri ZK14-S Pronto Digital Multifunction Kitchen and Food Scale, Black
product_meta.description: Color:BlackProudly selected by the Dana Farber Cancer Institute for a Harvard Medical School study on the link between weight loss and the prevention of breast cancer, the new Pronto Digital Kitchen Scale by Ozeri is an uncompromising multifunction scale for the kitchen and home. The Pronto is built with the latest generation in sensor technology to ensure an accurate and immediate response for the fast-paced chef, and features a newly enlarged weighing platform - one of the largest in its class, to accommodate larger bowls and food items. Elegantly designed with a refined finish, the Pronto also doubles as a postage machine for your mail or a scale for your children's science projects. The ultimate companion for the serious cook, the Pronto's large Unit button lets you change the unit of measurement with push-button ease, with 5 different units to choose from (g, lbs, lbs:oz, oz, ml) - e.g. convert (539.8 grams) to (1.19 pounds) to (1 pound 3 ounces) to (19.04 ounces) to (539.8 ml). The widescreen LCD displays provides wide viewing angle for the fast moving chef. Manufactured to rigorous quality specifications, the Pronto weighs up to 11.24 pounds (5100 grams) in graduations of just 0.05 ounces (1 gram) to help you achieve your diet and weight goals. The Pronto also features an ever handy Tare button which automatically subtracts the weight of any bowl or container to calculate the net weight of your ingredients. The Pronto's Tare and Unit buttons provide an audible and tactile click confirmation so you never have to push twice when preparing meals in a hurry. The Pronto's aesthetic design and availability in multiple colors complement any kitchen decor, and it cleans quickly and stores easily. The Pronto runs on 2 AAA batteries (included) with an easy-access battery compartment, and 2-minute automatic power-off to preserve battery life. It also ships with a bonus set of batteries, and is guaranteed by Ozeri's No-Hassle Warranty.
feature_bullets: Accurate, elegant, easy-to-use digital kitchen scale for your largest and smallest cooking projects - weighs up to 11.24 lbs (5100 grams) with precise graduations of 0.05 oz (1 gram).

Automatic Unit Button instantly converts between 5 units of measurements (g, lbs, lbs:oz, oz, ml) and displays results on an easy-to-read LCD screen - e.g. easily convert 539 grams to 1.188 pounds to 1 pound 3 ounces to 19.01 ounces to 539 ml.
Precision Tare Button calculates the net weight of your ingredients by automatically subtracting the weight of any bowl or container.
Features a newly enlarged weighing platform finished in elegant chrome, and 2 large buttons that generate an audible click confirmation. Cleans and stores easily.
Runs on 2 AAA batteries (included) that automatically power-off after 2-minutes to preserve battery life, and an easy-access battery compartment (no screwdriver needed). Satisfaction Guaranteed.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
